Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Nancy Pelosi "tried once again" to include abortion funding in the latest coronavirus bill, when in fact the bill does not mention abortion and the proposed changes to funding rules are not specific to Planned Parenthood.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the assertion that Nancy Pelosi attempted to include abortion funding in the bill.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the proposed changes to the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) provisions are specifically targeting Planned Parenthood, when in fact the expanded guidelines would make any large group, including Planned Parenthood, eligible for the loans.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists, as the proposed changes to funding rules are not specific to Planned Parenthood and would make any large group eligible for the loans, not just Planned Parenthood.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the bill does not explicitly restrict states from using funds to cover abortion services.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the bill does not mention abortion and that the proposed changes to funding rules are not specific to Planned Parenthood.
